trans-unit.source: Creating a log file for the code analysis tool
trans-unit.target: Creating a log file for the code analysis tool

trans-unit.source: The Windows Server 2012 [Hardware Certification Program](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=227016) requires a Driver Verification Log (DVL) for all applicable driver submissions.
trans-unit.target: The Windows Server 2012 [Hardware Certification Program](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=227016) requires a Driver Verification Log (DVL) for all applicable driver submissions.

trans-unit.source: You must run the Code Analysis tool prior to creating a DVL for your driver.
trans-unit.target: You must run the Code Analysis tool prior to creating a DVL for your driver.

trans-unit.source: The DVL contains a summary of the results from the Code Analysis and Static Driver Verifier log files.
trans-unit.target: The DVL contains a summary of the results from the Code Analysis and Static Driver Verifier log files.

trans-unit.source: The log files do not contain source code information.
trans-unit.target: The log files do not contain source code information.

trans-unit.source: To run code analysis on the driver
trans-unit.target: To run code analysis on the driver

trans-unit.source: In Microsoft Visual Studio Ultimate 2012, select the driver project file and then right-click to open the project properties.
trans-unit.target: In Microsoft Visual Studio Ultimate 2012, select the driver project file and then right-click to open the project properties.

trans-unit.source: Select **Windows 8 Release** as the **Configuration** and **x64** as the **Platform**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Windows 8 Release** as the **Configuration** and **x64** as the **Platform**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Analyze** or **Build** menu, click **Run Code Analysis on Solution**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Analyze** or **Build** menu, click **Run Code Analysis on Solution**.

trans-unit.source: If errors or warnings are found, use the **Code Analysis Report** window to investigate the cause of the errors.
trans-unit.target: If errors or warnings are found, use the **Code Analysis Report** window to investigate the cause of the errors.

trans-unit.source: Use the warning messages to fix those problems.
trans-unit.target: Use the warning messages to fix those problems.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Code Analysis tool, see [How to run Code Analysis for drivers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh454219) and [Analyzing C/C++ Code Quality by Using Code Analysis](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=226836).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Code Analysis tool, see [How to run Code Analysis for drivers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh454219) and [Analyzing C/C++ Code Quality by Using Code Analysis](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=226836).

trans-unit.source: The Code Analysis tool for drivers writes the results to the file vc.nativecodeanalysis.all.xml in the build configuration and platform sub-directory of your project, for example, \\Windows 8Release\\x64.
trans-unit.target: The Code Analysis tool for drivers writes the results to the file vc.nativecodeanalysis.all.xml in the build configuration and platform sub-directory of your project, for example, \\Windows 8Release\\x64.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Code Analysis for Drivers is a compile-time static verification tool that detects basic coding errors in C and C++ programs and includes a specialized module that is designed to detect errors in (primarily) kernel-mode driver code.
trans-unit.target: Code Analysis for Drivers is a compile-time static verification tool that detects basic coding errors in C and C++ programs and includes a specialized module that is designed to detect errors in (primarily) kernel-mode driver code.

trans-unit.source: In previous versions of the WDK, the driver-specific module for code analysis was part of a stand-alone tool called PREfast for Drivers (PFD).
trans-unit.target: In previous versions of the WDK, the driver-specific module for code analysis was part of a stand-alone tool called PREfast for Drivers (PFD).

trans-unit.source: You can also run the Code Analysis tool from a Visual Studio Command Prompt window.
trans-unit.target: You can also run the Code Analysis tool from a Visual Studio Command Prompt window.

trans-unit.source: Set up the environment by running one of the following batch files.
trans-unit.target: Set up the environment by running one of the following batch files.

trans-unit.source: -Or-
trans-unit.target: -Or-

trans-unit.source: Run the Code Analysis tool.
trans-unit.target: Run the Code Analysis tool.

trans-unit.source: For the most up-to-date information about the requirements for the Driver Verification Log, refer to the WDK Release Notes.
trans-unit.target: For the most up-to-date information about the requirements for the Driver Verification Log, refer to the WDK Release Notes.
